type.name: org.gradle.api.file.FileCopyDetails
type.description:
Provides details about a file or directory about to be copied, and allows some aspects of the destination file to be modified.

Using this interface, you can change the destination path of the file, filter the content of the file, or exclude the file from the result entirely.

Access to the source file itself after any filters have been added is not a supported operation.

method.name: getSourcePath
method.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the containing file tree.

Always uses '/' as the hierarchy separator, regardless of platform file separator. Same as calling getRelativeSourcePath().getPathString().

returns:The path, relative to the root of the containing file tree. Never returns null.

method.name: getRelativeSourcePath
method.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the containing file tree.

returns:The path, relative to the root of the containing file tree. Never returns null.

method.name: exclude
method.description: Excludes this file from the copy.

method.name: setMode
method.description:
Sets the Unix permissions of this file.
param:mode the Unix permissions, e.g. 0644.

method.name: getPath
method.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the copy destination.

Always uses '/' as the hierarchy separator, regardless of platform file separator. Same as calling getRelativePath().getPathString().

returns:The path, relative to the root of the copy destination. Never returns null.

method.name: setRelativePath
method.description:
Sets the destination path of this file.
param:path the new path for this file.

method.name: setDuplicatesStrategy
method.description: The strategy to use if there is already a file at this file's destination.

method.name: getRelativePath
method.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the copy destination.

returns:The path, relative to the root of the copy destination. Never returns null.

method.name: getName
method.description:
Returns the base name of this file at the copy destination.

returns:The destination name. Never returns null.

method.name: getDuplicatesStrategy
method.description:
The strategy to use if there is already a file at this file's destination.

The value can be set with a case insensitive string of the enum value (e.g. 'exclude' for DuplicatesStrategy#EXCLUDE). @see DuplicatesStrategy

returns:the strategy to use for this file.

method.name: getSourceName
method.description:
Returns the base name of this file at the copy source.

returns:The source name. Never returns null.

method.name: setName
method.description:
Sets the destination name of this file.
param:name The destination name of this file.

method.name: setPath
method.description:
Sets the destination path of this file.
param:path The path of this file.

property.name: mode
property.description:
Sets the Unix permissions of this file.
param:mode the Unix permissions, e.g. 0644.

property.name: name
property.description:
Returns the base name of this file at the copy destination.

returns:The destination name. Never returns null.

property.name: sourceName
property.description:
Returns the base name of this file at the copy source.

returns:The source name. Never returns null.

property.name: relativeSourcePath
property.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the containing file tree.

returns:The path, relative to the root of the containing file tree. Never returns null.

property.name: path
property.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the copy destination.

Always uses '/' as the hierarchy separator, regardless of platform file separator. Same as calling getRelativePath().getPathString().

returns:The path, relative to the root of the copy destination. Never returns null.

property.name: relativePath
property.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the copy destination.

returns:The path, relative to the root of the copy destination. Never returns null.

property.name: duplicatesStrategy
property.description:
The strategy to use if there is already a file at this file's destination.

The value can be set with a case insensitive string of the enum value (e.g. 'exclude' for DuplicatesStrategy#EXCLUDE). @see DuplicatesStrategy

returns:the strategy to use for this file.

property.name: sourcePath
property.description:
Returns the path of this file, relative to the root of the containing file tree.

Always uses '/' as the hierarchy separator, regardless of platform file separator. Same as calling getRelativeSourcePath().getPathString().

returns:The path, relative to the root of the containing file tree. Never returns null.
